title: Serif Pairing with Eurofence
content: I was wondering if anyone had a recommendation for a serif font to pair with Eurofurence- [http://www.dafont.com/search.php?psize=m&q=eurofurence](http://web.archive.org/web/20141127072408/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?psize=m&q=eurofurence "http://www.dafont.com/search.php?psize=m&q=eurofurence") (which ironically i did not know was connected to a furry conference in europe somehow). I am designing a menu and had been using MrsEaves, but the client doesn't like that combo as she thinks that they are too contrasting. It doesn't necessarily have to be a serif font, I looked at Century Gothic and Engravers Gothic, but there is a lot of text to fit, so most serif fonts tend to fit better. Any suggestions on a simpler serif? thanks!
author: redBicycleDesign

comments.content: I have to say I'm surprised you are dropping MrEaves… No offence to the designer of _Eurofurence_ but if I had to make a choice I know which typeface I would pick. What is the Menu for exactly...?
